comment: lots of homework, but you can get through most of it pretty easily. he does offer extra credit so take advantage when you get the chance! wasn't a fan of his teaching style but if you come to class you have a better chance of receiving extra credit or extra time on assignments.

He was probably the best and most engaging professor I've taken at Kennesaw. There was a ton of homework (60+ topic smartbooks, 120 question final), but it really wasn't that hard and was all multiple choice. His classes were pretty entertaining despite the somewhat boring subject matter.

I stopped going to class early on and still got good grades. there is a lot of homework but you have two weeks to do it. every two weeks you will have 2-3 smartbooks, an exam, and ABA's but they are so easy. do not wait until the day of to do the work you will drown. He allows a front and back page of notes for the lockdown exams!!

This is a fun and interesting class.  Always wants you to participate in discussions and is willing to help you with your grade if you do.  Subjects aren't always the easiest to follow but is willing to answer questions and help you out.  Would highly recommend this class.

He is a great professor. You can work ahead if you want. I stopped going to class halfway through the semester and currently have an A. Take the time to read the textbook for at least 30 minutes and you will be fine.

He is a great teacher. His lectures are entertaining and engaging. He has 6 test, interactive assignments, and smart book assignments. The information is really interesting, but overall a easy A if you study for 30 minutes everyday. You can easily pass the class.

Professor Falcone is super funny and super understanding as long as you take the time to participate in his classes. Once he knows your name the class gets a lot easier and no matter what he responds quickly to emails and after class concerns

The class assignments are all on Connect. SB assignments can take up a lot of your time but other than that, the course was really great. 6 Tests and a couple of really easy assignments to help as grade buffers. His lectures are great and will help you understand the material better. Take him.

This was a great class! Professor Falcone makes learning business law a lot of fun and interesting. You do have to purchase connect, and the smartbook assignments can be extremely long, but overall the class isn't too bad. Make sure to attend class, it will really benefit you to hear the debates on certain cases.

Really great professor. Enjoyed every one of his lectures. Gets the whole class involved, which is fun for debates. All you really need to do is keep up with the work, which is all due at the end of the semester, and you will be fine. Attendance was taken at random, but if you make an effort and get to know him a little bit he gives you leniency.

You have to take this guy for BLAW. It has become my favorite class throughout my first two years. It's not easy, but the professor actually being a lawyer helps a lot. He has great lectures (which need to be attended if you want to do well on the exams). Absolutely take this professor.

WHO IN THEIR RIGHT MIND GIVES A 150 QUESTION FINAL??? He will say attendance is mandatory but it's really not. You can read the textbook and do well on tests. He wants to make the class an ongoing discussion but will make you feel dumb if you can't fully articulate what you want to say. Try to take someone else if possible.

Very good at teaching concepts. If you want to actually learn something about law, he is a great choice. But, if you just need this class for credit, it isn't hard. A good amount of extra credit is provided. Tests come from the smartbook and in-class lectures. I didn't even take notes and got an A. Smartbook and ABA's are a free extra 200 points.

He was a great professor this class actually made me learn the material not just scoot by. All you do is read along and answer questions in the smart book. If you listen to the lectures and do the smart books you will pass. Beware of the exams/final they are online and proctored the final was super long but easy if you pay attention.

Professor Falcone is really nice and passionate about BLAW. The lectures can be a little boring and he acknowledges that, but you can tell he tries to make the best of the boring material. I showed up maybe 75% of the time and ended off with a B, but if you put in a little more effort than me (which isn't hard to do), you can easily get an A.

Hes a very nice professor. His lectures are helpful with understanding the course content. The only bad thing about this course is the course work is tedious and can be very long. Test are 50 questions, Homework (Smartbook) is anywhere from 80-140 questions total, Final was 150 questions. he does, however, allow you to do them at your own pace
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: great professor and lectures are fun to listen to. We often got out of class early, or you could chose to watch the online livestream. The only problem with this class is that the tests are on Connect and the material covered in class didn't line up very well with the test content. Read the textbook more than you watch the lectures and you're good

Great Professor! If you're scared of talking in class, you probably shouldn't take this course. Lectures are more of a conversation between class and prof. Very fun and engaging. Tests aren't very hard, but there were a lot of them. Cumulative final!!!
